title: Change Your Default Search Engine in Any Web Browser or Device

steps.title: Click the menu in Chrome ⋮.
steps.content: Click the menu in Chrome ⋮ . It's the icon with three vertical dots in the upper-right corner of the Google Chrome window. Clicking it prompts a drop-down menu. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's toward the bottom of the drop-down menu that appears when you click the icon with three vertical dots in the upper-right corner.

steps.title: Click Search engine.
steps.content: Click Search engine . It's in the menu bar to the left. This opens the search engine settings menu.

steps.title: Click Change.
steps.content: Click Change . It's in the box next to your current list of search engines.

steps.title: Select a search engine.
steps.content: Select a search engine. Click one of the search engines listed below the drop-down box to set it as your new search engine. From now on, any searches performed in the address bar at the top of the Chrome window will use this search engine.

steps.title: Add an unlisted search engine.
steps.content: Add an unlisted search engine. If you don't see your preferred search engine in the drop-down menu, you can add it. To do so, start by clicking Manage search engine and site search . It's the second option in the search engine settings menu, then click Add and enter the requested information: Search Engine: Enter the name of your preferred search engine on the line labeled "Search Engine" (i.e., "Google," "Bing," "DuckDuckGo "). Shortcut: Enter the shortcut you would enter in the address bar of your web browser to go to the website of your preferred search engine (i.e., "google.com," "bing.com," "duckduckgo.com"). URL with %s in place of Query: To get this information, go to the website of your preferred search engine and perform a random search. Copy the URL that appears in the address bar and replace the search terms in the URL with "%s" (i.e., " https://www.bing.com/search?q=%s "). When you're finished, click Add . To make it the default search engine, click ⋮ beside it and select Make Default . [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap ⋮ or ⋯ in the Chrome app.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ or ⋯ in the Chrome app. It's the icon with three dots in the top-right corner of the screen on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . On Android, you'll see this option near the bottom of the drop-down menu. On iPhone and iPad, you'll see it in the carousel of services at the top of the menu. [3] X Research source If you don't see the Settings menu in the drop-down menu, you may need to scroll down a bit or scroll right in the carousel on iPhone or iPad.

steps.title: Tap Search Engine.
steps.content: Tap Search Engine . It's under the "Basics" heading near the top of the screen. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Select a search engine.
steps.content: Select a search engine. Tap one of the search engines listed on this page. A blue checkmark or filled-in radio option will appear to the right of your currently active search engine.

steps.title: Open Safari and click the Safari menu.
steps.content: Open Safari and click the Safari menu. It's in the menu bar at the top-left side of the screen. Clicking it displays a drop-down menu. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . You'll see this option near the bottom of the drop-down menu. If you are using an older macOS version, this will read as "Preferences" instead.

steps.title: Click the Search tab.
steps.content: Click the Search tab. It's in the top-middle section of the Settings window.

steps.title: Click the "Search engine" drop-down box.
steps.content: Click the "Search engine" drop-down box. It's near the top of the Search page.

steps.title: Select a search engine.
steps.content: Select a search engine. Click the search engine you want to use with Safari to select it as your default. You can choose Google, Yahoo, Bing, or DuckDuckGo.

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings. It's the app with two silver gears. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Safari.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Safari . It's about a third of the way down the Settings page.

steps.title: Tap Search Engine.
steps.content: Tap Search Engine . It's the top option on this page below the "Search" header.

steps.title: Select a search engine.
steps.content: Select a search engine. Tap the search engine service you want to use. A blue checkmark will appear to the right of your currently selected option. You can choose Google, Yahoo, Bing, DuckDuckGo, or Ecosia.

steps.title: Click the menu in Microsoft Edge ⋯.
steps.content: Click the menu in Microsoft Edge ⋯ . It's in the upper-right corner of the browser window. [7] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . This option is at the bottom of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Privacy, search, and services.
steps.content: Click Privacy, search, and services . It's in the menu panel that appears on the left when you click the icon with three horizontal lines.

steps.title: Scroll down and click Address bar and search.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Address bar and search . It's at the bottom of the Privacy, search, and services menu.

steps.title: Click the drop-down menu next to "Search engine used in address bar."
steps.content: Click the drop-down menu next to "Search engine used in address bar." It's the option that is third from the bottom.

steps.title: Select a search engine.
steps.content: Select a search engine. Click the search engine you want to use in the drop-down menu. You can choose Bing, Google, DuckDuckGo, or Yahoo.

steps.title: Add an unlisted search engine.
steps.content: Add an unlisted search engine. If you don't see your preferred search engine in the drop-down menu, you can add it. To do so, click Manage search engines at the bottom of the menu and follow these steps: Click Manage search engines . Click Add . Enter the name of your preferred search engine (i.e., "Google," "Bing," "Yahoo") on the line labeled "Search engine." Enter the shortcut you would enter in the address bar to go to the website for your preferred website (i.e., "google.com," "bing.com," "duckduckgo.com0") on the line labeled "Keyword." URL with %s in place of query: To get this information, perform a random search using your preferred search engine. Copy the URL that appears in the address bar and replace the search terms with "%s" (i.e., " https://www.google.com/search?q=%s .") Click Add . You can now use the drop-down menu to select your preferred search engine.

steps.title: Tap ☰ (Android) or ⋯ (iPhone and iPad) in the Edge app.
steps.content: Tap ☰ (Android) or ⋯ (iPhone and iPad) in the Edge app. On Android devices, it's the icon with three horizontal lines in the lower-right corner. On iPhone and iPad, it's the icon with three dots in the upper-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Settings .
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's below an icon that resembles a gear. It's the last option in the pop-up menu that appears when you tap the icon with three dots. [8] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Tap General .
steps.content: Tap General . It's the third option in the Settings menu. It is also next to an icon that resembles a gear.

steps.title: Tap Select search engine.
steps.content: Tap Select search engine . It's near the top of the General Settings menu. This displays a list of search engines you can choose from.

steps.title: Tap your preferred search engine.
steps.content: Tap your preferred search engine. You can choose Bing, Yahoo, Google, or DuckDuckGo. This displays a checkmark or a filled-in radio option next to your choice. Microsoft Edge will use this search engine when you enter search terms in the address bar.

steps.title: Click the menu in Firefox ☰.
steps.content: Click the menu in Firefox ☰ . It's the icon with three horizontal lines in the upper-right corner of the Firefox window. This displays a drop-down menu. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . This button is near the middle of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Search.
steps.content: Click Search . It's in the menu panel to the left. This displays the search settings menu.

steps.title: Click the search engine drop-down box.
steps.content: Click the search engine drop-down box. This is the box below the "Default Search Engine" heading at the top of the page. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Select a search engine.
steps.content: Select a search engine. Click a search engine in the drop-down menu to apply it to Firefox. From this point on, Firefox will use your selected search engine when you type information into the address bar. If you don't see a search engine you like, scroll to the bottom of the page and click Find more search engines at the bottom. This opens the extensions store. You can find an extension for your preferred search, or you can go to the website for your preferred search engine, right-click the address bar and click Add to Firefox .

steps.title: Tap ☰ (iPhone and iPad) or ⋮ (Android) in the Firefox app.
steps.content: Tap ☰ (iPhone and iPad) or ⋮ (Android) in the Firefox app. On iPhone and iPad, it's the icon with three horizontal lines in the upper-right corner. On Android, it's the icon with three vertical dots in the lower-right corner. This opens the menu.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's at the bottom of the menu. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Search.
steps.content: Tap Search . This option is near the top of the page.

steps.title: Tap the current default search engine (iPhone or iPad) or tap Default search engine (Android).
steps.content: Tap the current default search engine (iPhone or iPad) or tap Default search engine (Android). It's at the top of the search menu.

steps.title: Select a search engine.
steps.content: Select a search engine. Tap a search engine that you would like to use to set it as your new default. A blue checkmark will appear next to your selected search engine, signifying that Firefox will use it when you search in the address bar from now on. If you don't see your preferred search engine listed, tap Add search engine below the list of search engines. Then tap Other (Android only). Enter the name of your preferred search engine (i.e., "DuckDuckGo," "Yahoo") and enter the search query URL with the search terms replaced by "%s". You can find the search query by performing a random search with your web browser. Copy the URL that appears in the address bar and replace the search terms with "%s" (i.e., " https://www.google.com/search?q=%s .")
